body: "This is a powerful narrative. Just the kind of story we want to tell! But we have to get this out before the facts come out! Hurry! The facts are closing in!" screamed a CNN reporter as he jumped in his news van to rush over to the site of the incident.

title: Journalists Rush To Get Story Out Before It Can Be Ruined By The Facts

body:
They hit the nail on the head with this one.

The media wants to fit every situation into the “white supremacist killer takes out a bunch of black people” narrative box but they always have to twist and distort the story/ignore major factors to get it to fit into that box (except maybe Dylan Roof).  The problem is the average normie media consumer doesn’t stick around long enough to get all the facts or to see them quietly redact their original story.

Remember how they tried to make the kid with the MAGA hat who literally just sat there while someone beat a drum in his face an angry Indian hating white supremacist?  Most people just bought this narrative and refused to see the full picture before the facts came out that the kid wa s just standing there (while enduring racist slurs for over an hour from another group...)

Sigh... the media has made narrative more important than facts.
body_html:
They hit the nail on the head with this one.

The media wants to fit every situation into the “white supremacist killer takes out a bunch of black people” narrative box but they always have to twist and distort the story/ignore major factors to get it to fit into that box (except maybe Dylan Roof). The problem is the average normie media consumer doesn’t stick around long enough to get all the facts or to see them quietly redact their original story.

Remember how they tried to make the kid with the MAGA hat who literally just sat there while someone beat a drum in his face an angry Indian hating white supremacist? Most people just bought this narrative and refused to see the full picture before the facts came out that the kid wa s just standing there (while enduring racist slurs for over an hour from another group...)

Sigh... the media has made narrative more important than facts.
